experience: You and Urian both know Jeff Magill, Jocelyn Tuohy, and 9 others

Responsible for evaluating compatibility, functionality, and usability of InFocus collaboration software. • Started as Software QA Engineer. Promoted to Senior Software QA Engineer.• Consistently recognized as the top performing tester in the software QA department (15 people).• Assess all InFocus Unified Communication products from Mondopad to 121 SIP Service and ConX Video Meetings.• Author and execute test plans for InFocus software on desktop and mobile platforms, including Windows, iOS, and Android.• Plan for and operate in project life cycles with Agile software development. • Created custom system images for Windows 7, 8.1, and 10 for production deployment. • Created Python script to manage the company’s AWS instances.• Created automated scripts for application testing on Windows 10.

Responsible for executing device testing/certification tasks, tracking and resolving project issues in a timely manner and managing project deliverables and deadlines.• Successfully reached Technical Approval for new devices.• Created guides for device launch timelines and requirements for future product planning and management.• Organized and created After Action Review and Lessons Learned PowerPoint presentations for internal and external reviews at the end of a project.

Entrusted with conducting and presenting market research on developing trends for product innovation, business optimization, and marketing strategy. • Created and continue to write for "The Smart Cookie", Coolpad's informational newsletter.• Create overview and oversee training for LTE IOT OTA testing. • Conduct market surveys, collect results, analyze and make reports about potential product trends.• Analyze marketing results of current programs and make necessary recommendations.• Provide competitive market analysis on current and future products related to product specs, wholesale/retail pricing, and identify the target demographic/market for the product. • Monitor blogs and social media for product and competitor reports.• Work with marketing teams to create messages based on blogs and social media reports, etc.• Maintain issue and error trend analyses to monitor trends of products in development.
Software and Hardware Testing Lead Intern

Empowered to guide and manage test teams through final testing phase with MetroPCS. Charged with writing, translating, and editing numerous technical and marketing documents for device launch. Effectively executed store visits on behalf of marketing, sales and training, and reverse logistics departments.• Coordinated and executed MetroPCS LTE and CDG3 field tests in Irvine, CA; Los Angeles, CA; and Las Vegas, NV regions.• Conducted and worked closely with Yulong Coolpad engineers and MetroPCS corporate engineers and employees in Dallas, TX with testing and debugging during the FUT phase. • Successfully executed LTE IOT testing at Ericsson labs in Montreal, Canada, and simultaneously coordinated CDMA Ev-Do testing at Ericsson labs in Dallas, TX. • Mentored Coolpad interns in CDMA and LTE field testing, OEM and applications testing, and FUT issue testing. • Wrote, translated, and edited numerous technical and marketing documents: software release notes, test plans, user manuals, website articles, press release, marketing and promotional materials, and technical guides for sales and training, reverse logistics, and internal use. • Conducted month-long visitations of MetroPCS dealers and corporate stores in the Los Angeles, San Francisco, and Sacramento regions working closely with MetroPCS account service representatives and account managers to gather data and research for Coolpad's Marketing, Sales & Training, and Reverse Logistics departments. • Prepared and presented product launch training materials to 800+ MetroPCS sales representatives in the Dallas region and to Coolpad's Sales & Training department.
